description: Design a global preventive health approach that reduces burnout and chronic stress at population scale, is economically viable, culturally inclusive, non-coercive, and cannot be medicalized or captured by institutional authority.
constraints: Must be economically viable without creating new dependencies
Must be culturally inclusive across diverse global populations
Must be non-coercive (no mandates, penalties, or forced participation)
Cannot be medicalized (no pharmaceutical or clinical intervention requirements)
Cannot be captured by institutional authority (governmental, corporate, or medical)
Must address root causes of burnout and chronic stress
Must be sustainable without ongoing centralized funding
Must not create new forms of social stratification or inequality
Must work without requiring universal behavior change
